remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供了高性能设置操作。The class provides high-performance set operations. 一组是不包含任何重复的元素的集合，并且其元素是顺序不分先后。A set is a collection that contains no duplicate elements, and whose elements are in no particular order. > [!NOTE] > 实现开头的接口[!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]; 在以前版本的.NET Framework 中，类未实现此接口。 implements the interface starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v46](~/includes/net-v46-md.md)]; in previous versions of the .NET Framework, the class did not implement this interface. 容量对象是该对象可以容纳的元素数目。The capacity of a object is the number of elements that the object can hold. 一个自动对象的容量会增加，如元素添加到的对象。A object's capacity automatically increases as elements are added to the object. 类的数学集的模型为基础，并提供高性能设置的操作类似于访问的密钥或集合。The class is based on the model of mathematical sets and provides high-performance set operations similar to accessing the keys of the or collections. 简单来说，类可以认为的不包含值的集合。In simple terms, the class can be thought of as a collection without values. 一个集合不排序，并且不能包含重复元素。A collection is not sorted and cannot contain duplicate elements. 如果顺序或元素重复，更注重应用程序的性能，请考虑使用类一起使用方法。If order or element duplication is more important than performance for your application, consider using the class together with the method. 提供了许多数学设置操作，如集添加 （联合），并设置减法。 provides many mathematical set operations, such as set addition (unions) and set subtraction. 下表列出了所提供操作和及其数学等效项。The following table lists the provided operations and their mathematical equivalents. |Hashset 集合操作HashSet operation|数学等效项Mathematical equivalent| |-------------------------------|-----------------------------| ||Union 或将其设置的添加Union or set addition| ||交集Intersection| ||集减法Set subtraction| ||余集Symmetric difference| 列出的 set 操作中，除了类还提供了用于确定集是否相等，重叠的集，方法和一组是子集或另一个集的超集。In addition to the listed set operations, the class also provides methods for determining set equality, overlap of sets, and whether a set is a subset or superset of another set. 对于非常大对象，可以通过设置增加到 20 亿元素在 64 位系统上的最大容量`enabled`到的配置元素的特性`true`在运行时环境中。For very large objects, you can increase the maximum capacity to 2 billion elements on a 64-bit system by setting the `enabled` attribute of the configuration element to `true` in the run-time environment. 从开始[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]，则类实现接口。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], the class implements the interface. ## HashSet 和 LINQ Set 运算HashSet and LINQ Set Operations LINQ 提供了对访问`Distinct`， `Union`，`Intersect`并`Except`set 实现的任何数据源上的操作或接口。LINQ provides access to the `Distinct`, `Union`, `Intersect` and `Except` set operations on any data source that implements the or interfaces. 提供了更大、 更可靠集合操作的集合。 provides a larger and more robust collection of set operations. 例如，提供的比较，例如和。For example, provides comparisons such as and . LINQ 的主要区别将操作设置并操作是 LINQ set 运算始终返回一个新集合，而等效的方法修改当前的集合。The primary difference between LINQ set operations and operations is that LINQ set operations always return a new collection, whereas the equivalent methods modify the current collection. 通常情况下，如果必须创建新组或应用程序需要访问仅向提供的组操作，使用 LINQ 设置对任何操作将足以集合或数组。Typically, if you must create a new set or if your application needs access only to the provided set operations, using LINQ set operations on any collection or array will be sufficient. 但是，如果应用程序需要额外的一组操作访问权限或不需要或不必要创建一个新集合，使用类。However, if your application requires access to additional set operations, or if it is not desirable or necessary to create a new collection, use the class. 下表显示操作和其等效的 LINQ set 运算。The following table shows the operations and their equivalent LINQ set operations. |Hashset 集合操作HashSet operation|LINQ 等效项LINQ equivalent| |-------------------------------|---------------------| ||| ||| ||| |未提供。Not provided.|| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ||未提供。Not provided.| ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何合并两个不同的集。The following example demonstrates how to merge two disparate sets. 此示例创建两个对象，它们分别奇数和偶数数字来填充它们。This example creates two objects, and populates them with even and odd numbers, respectively. 第三个集，其中包含偶数值，从创建对象。A third object is created from the set that contains the even numbers. 该示例然后调用方法，它将奇数的数字组添加到第三个组。The example then calls the method, which adds the odd number set to the third set. summary.span: 返回循环访问 对象的枚举器。

span.span: Returns an enumerator that iterates through a object.
A object for the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此，使用`foreach`建议而不是直接操作枚举器。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义属性。At this position, the property is undefined. 因此，您必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回同一对象，直到调用。The property returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 不能设置再次为集合的第一个元素必须创建新的枚举数对象相反。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator object instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果进行了更改到集合中，例如添加、 修改或删除元素，该枚举数将失效且不可恢复，并且下次调用或引发。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and the next call to or throws an . 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏枚举器的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义属性。At this position, the property is undefined. 因此，您必须调用方法将枚举数前移到集合，然后再读取的值的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call the method to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 属性返回同一对象，直到调用。The property returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果越过集合，枚举器的末尾放置在集合中的最后一个元素的后面和返回`false`。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns `false`. 当枚举数位于此位置上，对后续调用还返回`false`。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return `false`. 如果最后一次调用到返回`false`，是不确定的。If the last call to returned `false`, is undefined. 不能设置再次为集合的第一个元素必须创建新的枚举数对象相反。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator object instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized. 此方法为 o （1） 运算。This method is an O(1) operation.

summary.span: 修改当前 对象以包含存在于该对象中、指定集合中或两者中的所有元素。

span.span: Modifies the current object to contain all elements that are present in itself, the specified collection, or both.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法为 O (`n`) 操作，其中`n`是中的元素数`other`参数。This method is an O(`n`) operation, where `n` is the number of elements in the `other` parameter. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何合并两个不同的集。The following example demonstrates how to merge two disparate sets. 此示例创建两个对象，它们分别奇数和偶数数字来填充它们。This example creates two objects, and populates them with even and odd numbers, respectively. 第三个集，其中包含偶数值，从创建对象。A third object is created from the set that contains the even numbers. 该示例然后调用方法，它将奇数的数字组添加到第三个组。The example then calls the method, which adds the odd number set to the third set.
